summary: This bill, the "Preserving Patient Access to Home Infusion Act," aims to clarify and protect patient access to home infusion therapy under Medicare. It amends the Social Security Act to include pharmacy services, adjust payment structures to reflect different scenarios (including when a supplier isn't physically present), and allow nurse practitioners and physician assistants to participate in establishing and reviewing home infusion plans. The bill also addresses access to home infusion for non-pump drugs and biologicals and modifies payment for home infusion supplies. Effective date for most changes is January 1, 2026.
